title: Of Course House Republicans Are Already Souring on Speaker Mike Johnson
description: Johnson has failed to do anything about the structural deficiencies that Kevin McCarthy couldn't address before getting booted.

title: How Liz Cheney’s Book Makes the Case for a Potential Presidential Run
description: "If Donald Trump is the Republican nominee in 2024, we must do everything we can to defeat him."

title: Federal Trade Commission Investigating Exxon’s $60B Merger With Texas Oil Company
description: Democratic senators have urged the FTC to investigate both the Exxon-Pioneer and Chevron-Hess deals for potentially violating antitrust law.

title: Suicides Don’t Actually Spike in Winter
description: The myth of a holiday-suicide connection is both false and harmful, experts say.

description: Historians Tom Holland and Dominic Sandbrook on exploring history's most entertaining moments in 'The Rest Is History'

title: Why India Is Targeting Sikhs At Home and Around the World
description: At home and abroad the Modi government is targeting Sikhs, a continuation of a dark history in India.

title: U.S. Military Equipment Traced to Possible War Crimes in Gaza, Report Finds
description: Israel used U.S. military equipment to kill 43 civilians in Gaza—a possible war crime, Amnesty International says.

title: From Ukraine to Israel, Congress Can’t Abandon Our Allies
description: Before the end of 2023, Congress must pass supplemental funding to support Ukraine, Israel, and other American priorities around the world.

title: The 10 Best Albums of 2023
description: From SZA to Zach Bryan, see TIME's picks for the best albums of 2023.

title: There Are More Fossil Fuel Lobbyists Than Ever at COP28
description: The number of fossil fuel lobbyists at this year's COP28 climate conference in Dubai is nearly four times as much as last year.

title: Nigeria’s President Orders Investigation Into 85 Deaths Caused by Military Drones
description: The tragedy occurred while worshippers were celebrating a Muslim holiday.

title: TIME Is Looking For the World’s Top Ed Tech Companies
description: For the first time, TIME will debut a ranking of the World’s Top EdTech Companies, in partnership with Statista, a leading international provider of market and consumer data and rankings. This new list will identify the most innovative, impactful, and growing companies in EdTech, which have established themselves as leaders in the EdTech industry. Companies…

title: We Don’t Have to Choose Between Ethical AI and Innovative AI
description: AI can be harnessed for social good, such as a new app to help mothers navigate paid leave policies, writes Reshma Saujani of Girls Who Code.

title: Global Carbon Emissions Keep Increasing
description: The world this year pumped 1.1% more carbon dioxide into the air than last year because of increased pollution from China and India.

title: A California YouTuber Gets 6 Months in Jail for Crashing Plane for Clicks
description: The original video by American snowboarder and extreme sports athlete Trevor Jacob is still on YouTube. Nobody was harmed.

title: Alex Newell
description: Newell spoke to TIME about what it really felt like to win that Tony, their vision for their career as an artist, and their ideal role

title: Lionel Messi
description: Messi managed to do what once seemed impossible: turning the U.S. into a soccer country.

title: Danish and Swedish Unions Are Gearing Up for a Labor Dispute With Tesla
description: Denmark will refuse to transport Tesla shipments in solidarity with a Swedish union demanding a collective bargaining agreement.

title: Putin Is Visiting Saudi Arabia, UAE for Israel-Hamas War Talks. Here’s What to Know
description: The trip reflects the isolated Russian leader's attempts to increase his country's influence in the Middle East.

title: Hospitals Should Be Redesigned to Improve Care
description: Danish Kurani explores three ways hospitals can be redesigned to benefit both patients and doctors.

title: About 400 Rohingya at Risk of Perishing at Sea, U.N. Warns, Urging Rescue of Stranded Ships
description: Over 3,400 Rohingya refugees—most of whom are women and children—have embarked on sea journeys since January 2023, and 225 of them have been reported dead or missing, according to the UNHCR.

title: New Grand Theft Auto Trailer Drops, 10 Years After Last Installment in Video Game Franchise. Here’s What to Know
description: The newest chapter in one of America’s most popular and violent video games is scheduled for a 2025 release. Here’s what we know so far.

title: At Least 13 Killed in Gunfight in India’s Manipur Amid Ongoing Ethnic Unrest
description: The Indian state, which shares a border with Myanmar, has been roiled by simmering ethnic unrest since May.

title: After Indonesian Curbs on TikTok Shop, ByteDance Pursues E-Commerce Ambitions With New Local Partnership
description: A tieup with a savvy local operator could provide a model for TikTok as it pursues expansion in other markets.

title: 23andMe Hack Breaches 6.9 Million Profiles, Including Some’s Health Data
description: Privacy advocates have long warned that sharing DNA with testing companies like 23andMe and Ancestry makes consumers vulnerable to the exposure of sensitive genetic information that can reveal health risks of individuals and those who are related to them.
